Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using Flask in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Flask-based HTTP server for managing blueprints, including operations for retrieving, storing, and validating blueprint data and associated tarballs. The server should handle various HTTP methods (GET, PUT) and include metrics tracking for bandwidth and request counts.

Class Description: BlueprintServer is a Flask application wrapper that provides endpoints for blueprint management, including CRUD operations for blueprints and their associated tarballs. It includes validation, metrics tracking, and response handling.

Attributes:
- app: Flask - The Flask application instance
- browser_pattern: re.Pattern - Regular expression pattern for detecting browser user agents

Methods:
- __init__() -> None - Initializes the Flask app and sets up routes
- _setup_routes() -> None - Defines all URL routes and their associated handlers
- _blueprint(secret: str, name: str) -> Union[Blueprint, None, bool] - Retrieves and validates a blueprint from the backend
- _server() -> str - Returns the server's base URL
- _validate_secret(secret: str) -> None - Validates the secret format (400 if invalid)
- _validate_name(name: str) -> None - Validates the name format (400 if invalid)
- _validate_sha(sha: str) -> None - Validates the SHA format (400 if invalid)
- secret() -> MeteredResponse - Generates and returns a new secret (201 response)
- get_blueprint(secret: str, name: str) -> Union[MeteredResponse, abort] - Retrieves a blueprint (200/301/404 response)
- put_blueprint(secret: str, name: str) -> MeteredResponse - Stores a new blueprint (202/400/502 response)
- get_tarball(secret: str, name: str, sha: str) -> Union[redirect, abort] - Retrieves a tarball (301/404 response)
- put_tarball(secret: str, name: str, sha: str) -> MeteredResponse - Stores a new tarball (202/400/502 response)
- sh(secret: str, name: str, name2: str) -> Union[MeteredResponse, abort] - Generates shell script (200/400/404/502 response)
- user_data(secret: str, name: str) -> MeteredResponse - Generates user-data script (200/404/502 response)
- run() -> None - Starts the Flask development server
